name: NetworkAclEntry
description: Creates an entry (i.e., rule) in a network ACL with a rule number you specify. Each network ACL has a set of numbered ingress rules and a separate set of numbered egress rules.

properties.name: CidrBlock
properties.description: The CIDR range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation (e.g., 172.16.0.0/24).

properties.name: Egress
properties.description: Whether this rule applies to egress traffic from the subnet (true) or ingress traffic to the subnet (false). By default, AWS CloudFormation specifies false.

properties.name: Icmp
properties.description: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) code and type.

properties.name: NetworkAclId
properties.description: ID of the ACL where the entry will be created.

properties.name: PortRange
properties.description: The range of port numbers for the UDP/TCP protocol.

properties.name: Protocol
properties.description: The IP protocol that the rule applies to. You must specify -1 or a protocol number (go to Protocol Numbers at iana.org). You can specify -1 for all protocols.

properties.name: RuleAction
properties.description: Whether to allow or deny traffic that matches the rule; valid values are "allow" or "deny".

properties.name: RuleNumber
properties.description: Rule number to assign to the entry (e.g., 100). This must be a positive integer from 1 to 32766.
